meanings.sent1: The climbers used a sturdy seils to reach the mountain peak.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to pack extra seils for our camping trip.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the seils for a new toy.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a strong seils, always keeping her grounded.
meanings.sent5: The bright red seils stood out against the green trees, guiding the hikers.

meanings.definition: Seils (verb): to descend a steep slope or cliff using a rope
meanings.sent1: We will seils down the rocky cliff carefully.
meanings.sent2: Remember to seils slowly to avoid any accidents.
meanings.sent3: The brave explorer decided to seils down the waterfall for fun.
meanings.sent4: His confidence allowed him to seils down the challenge effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The experienced climber demonstrated how to seils down the mountain with ease.

meanings.definition: Seils (adjective): relating to or characteristic of ropes or cords
meanings.sent1: The seils knot was securely tied to the tree.
